channel.title: Adfly integration w/ phpbb
channel.description:
Recently, i've been trying to integrate adly onto my phpbb forum, but i cant get it to work, i have a few questions...
1.I know i would have to edit the index php, but what else? functions?
2.Could i do it with the "Full page script" option w/ adfly?
Oh, and just a notice, im not doing this for money for myself, simply for revenue to keep my website and my server up..
Tryed using the full page script, but i get errors when going to the index page on my forum..

item.title: Adfly integration w/ phpbb
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:10, topic:394529”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=491715.msg3595867#msg3595867 date=1305068473]
Ahh, well a rather crude way I’ve found is to go to styles//template/overall_header.html, find the tag, and add your script before that. [/quote] How is that crude? That’s what you’d want to do[/quote]

Essentially you’d want it to be automated by their MOD system to loop through every installed theme and if not found, add the script. I haven’t looked into phpBB’s hook system, but with MyBB you can just use the pre_output_page hook and add the script dynamically.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:9, topic:394529”]Ahh, well a rather crude way I’ve found is to go to styles//template/overall_header.html, find the tag, and add your script before that.[/quote] How is that crude? That’s what you’d want to do

Read full topic

item.title: Adfly integration w/ phpbb
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Ahh, well a rather crude way I’ve found is to go to styles//template/overall_header.html, find the tag, and add your script before that. You’ll have to do it for your default theme, and any other themes if you allow the option to change them. I’ve yet to find an easy way with their MOD system, so you’ll have to manually add them.

Read full topic

item.title: Adfly integration w/ phpbb
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:5, topic:394529”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=491715.msg3595771#msg3595771 date=1305062913]

What exactly is adly? Is it on page ads like Adsense? Or is it one of those redirection techniques that make money?

And what are you trying to do?

I guess i wasnt clear enough :o.
K, so basically, when they come to my website mywebsite.org, they get redirected to forums.mywebsite.org, basically making it so that adfly banners are displayed on the pages in the forum, like on the index, there is an adfly banner, on a topic, there is a adfly banner, like that.
[/quote]

Ahh okay, so you’d want a mod to do this. Not too sure about phpBB, but I know MyBB has a hook system which would make the banner extremely easy to do.

Basically you’d want to replace the page before it gets sent to the browser with the version that has the banner.[/quote]
Would i have to do that?
Or, using the script given on the adfly website, could i just add this script to the index php, wouldnt that just automatically give it the adfly banner?

[code]

[/code]

But i tried adding it onto the index file, but i got errors, would i add it inside the php tags in the index, outside it, or is it not possible like that?

Or does that have to be made as a seperate file…

Read full topic

item.title: Adfly integration w/ phpbb
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:4, topic:394529”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=491715.msg3595760#msg3595760 date=1305061824]
What exactly is adly? Is it on page ads like Adsense? Or is it one of those redirection techniques that make money?

And what are you trying to do?
[/quote]
I guess i wasnt clear enough :o.
K, so basically, when they come to my website mywebsite.org, they get redirected to forums.mywebsite.org, basically making it so that adfly banners are displayed on the pages in the forum, like on the index, there is an adfly banner, on a topic, there is a adfly banner, like that.[/quote]

Ahh okay, so you’d want a mod to do this. Not too sure about phpBB, but I know MyBB has a hook system which would make the banner extremely easy to do.

Basically you’d want to replace the page before it gets sent to the browser with the version that has the banner.

Read full topic
